page.title: 18 RUGELEY TOWN CENTRE
page.content: The centre of Rugeley has changed a lot over the last few years. Upper Brook Street, Market Square, Albion Street and Brewery Street are no longer used by vehicles. The centre has been pedestrianised. The old roads have been paved with bricks and this has made the shopping area much safer and more pleasant. The Old Market Hall has gone and a modern indoor Market Hall has been built near to the bus station, although a lot of people think there should be a market in Market Square. One thing that spoils the new look of Rugeley is the litter which people drop everywhere. There are litter bins but few people use them. The town centre could look very nice with it's red/blue brick paving, trees and flower beds.
